attributes.action: request a full independant inquiry into British involvement in the Iraq War
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This petition calls on our Prime Minister to launch a full independant inquiry into the decission to invade Iraq. This petition proposes that the inquiry be headed by a member of the Judiciary who would be impartial to the findings of the inquiry.

The undersinded of the petetion would ask that the inquiry look into the following areas ( and any others that may occur).

1. The source and authentisity of the evidence presented to the public for the invasion of Iraq.

2. The legality of the war in Iraq based on a British perspective

3. The role the Prime Minister played in preparing the war with the United States and wether the situation was moral and legal.

4. Based on the findings of this independant inquiry was it fair just and resonable at that specific time to invade Iraq

5. What lessons can be learnt form the invasion

6. If any member of the goverment at that time directly or indirectly manipulated and fed false information to the general public on the invasion of Iraq
